results.title: Laurel & Hardy: Wrong again. Angora love. They go boom
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach, Leo McCarey, Lewis R. Foster and James Parrott
results.brief_description: Three classic comic shorts from Laurel and Hardy. In “Wrong again” (20 mins. 1929), a comedy with a surrealistic edge, stable-hands Stan and Ollie respond to a millionaire’s offer of a reward for ‘Blue Boy’, a missing painting, by delivering ‘Blue Boy’ a horse. They find an instruction to leave ‘Blue Boy’ on the piano. In “Angora love” (20 mins. 1929) Stan and Ollie are adopted by a runaway goat. In “They go boom” (20 mins. 1927) the boys try to cure Stan’s mysterious illness and throw the landlord into distress when the cure escalates into a disaster.
results.title_for_label: Laurel & Hardy: Wrong again. Angora love. They go boom

results.title: Laurel & Hardy: sons of the desert. We faw down
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Hal Roach Studios, Hal Roach, William Seiter and Leo McCarey
results.brief_description: Two comedies from popular slapstick team Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy. “Sons of the desert” - Stan and Ollie wish to attend the Sons of the desert annual convention (read booze up) but Ollie’s domineering wife forbids it. Determined to go, Stan has a cunning plan - if Ollie pretends to be deathly ill the two will take a recuperative trip to Honolulu then sneak off to Chicago. The plan goes awry when the ship they were supposed to be travelling on is devastated by a typhoon and the henpecked pair have to face the wrath of their wives. Considered the best of Laurel and Hardy’s feature films, with over the top sight gags and slapstick humour, this was one of the top ten grossing pictures of 1934. “We faw down” - Stan and Ollie fancy spending the night playing poker. Their disapproving wives refuse them permission so feigning an appointment with their boss, the two pretend to be off to the theatre for the night. When, unbeknownst to Laurel and Hardy, the theatre burns down the pair are trapped in a lie and are asked to act out the play they ‘saw’ in front of their disbelieving wives.

results.title: Laurel & Hardy Utopia
results.brief_description: Utopia is the final feature in the 25 year career of Laurel and Hardy who were known and loved throughout the world - without a doubt, the most the most successful and best loved comedy duo the world has ever known. In Utopia, Stan and Ollie get into yet `another fine mess’ when they inherit a Pacific island and to everyone’s surprise discover Uranium.

results.title: Laura's pregnant!
results.creator_credit: Queen Victoria Hospital Foundation, Deane Hutton and Jean Anne DeVoe
results.brief_description: Laura’s pregnant! follows 16 year old Laura as she discovers she is pregnant and reflects back on how it all happened, the myths her pregnancy refutes and how she and the baby’s father deal with the situation emotionally and the dilemmas they face. The program briefly explores her options of termination, adoption, marriage and single parenting, without revealing which decision she chooses. A teacher’s guide accompanies the video and provides activities around each section of the tape as well as an extensive bibliography. Suitable for lower and middle secondary school students.

results.title: Laura
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Otto Preminger
results.brief_description: The haunting story of Laura - an elegant young woman viciously murdered, is told in a series of flashbacks from the perspective of acidic newspaper columnist Waldo Lydecker (Clifton Webb). Dana Andrews plays the detective who is investigating the murder and who finds himself becoming obsessed, and eventually falling in love with a portrait of the “dead” woman. Preminger’s direction is masterful and the cinematography deservedly won an Academy Award in 1944. The cast includes Judith Anderson, Vincent Price and most notably Gene Tierney as the mysterious and very beautiful Laura. Based on the novel by Vera Caspary.

results.title: Laundering woollen blankets in hospitals
results.brief_description: How woollen blankets which have been shrinkproofed and mothproofed may be laundered. The CSIRO’s shrink and mothproofing process; the advantages of woollen blankets; the basic procedures, which can be used in any hospital laundry with or without modern equipment.

results.title: Laugh slap howl
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Cath Murphy
results.brief_description: An animated film about an old lady and her dog living together in a block of flats who are disturbed by some unearthly noises coming from the hallway. Both scared, they proceed down the hall to a darkly lit room, the source of the strange noises.

results.title: Laugh lines: a profile of Kaj Pindal
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Walt Disney, Derek Lamb, David Verrall, Zina Heczko and Franco Battista
results.brief_description: Laugh Lines is a film portrait of animator Kaj Pindal. He is seen at work creating zany cartoon characters, teaching students of animation, and at home enjoying another of his creations, a full-size streetcar that tours his backyard. The laughter in Pindal’s life is evident in this delightful film biography. Photographed by Raymond Dumas and Richard Mores. Edited by Ian Rankin. Music by Betty Lazebnik. (Awards: Cracow; San Antonio.)

results.title: Latitude, longitude and time zones
results.brief_description: Shows how parallels of latitude and meridians of longitude can be used to determine the position of a place anywhere on the earth’s surface. Explains how the time zones were established. Suitable for upper secondary level.
